posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: I loved the way you avoid getting 16 BAB, LOVE IT! But you could spread out the remaining levels of Monk for skill dumps along the way, no? AFAIK it's allowed.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:I loved the way you avoid getting 16 BAB, LOVE IT! But you could spread out the remaining levels of Monk for skill dumps along the way, no? AFAIK it's allowed.
This build was set up according to the rules explained about leveling on Arelith, that 3-level minimum whenever you take another class. At least that was the way I understood it, only by interpreting the requestor's instructions, one that seemed to evolve further as suggestions were made. Naturally, if it is possible to dump to a multiclass as in "normal" building, that is what I would have recommended to avoid inefficient "clumping"... a rather benign adjustment to the posted build IMO.

What is really needed is an entry in the PW section that briefly describes the rules that impact character building on each server (Arelith, WoG, Amia, etc.) listing custom requirements and accommodations so that guild members who play them can keep it up-to-date and guild builders will have an accurate template. I don't really care for RP servers myself so it is unlikely I will ever gain any real-time experience with Arelith (or any other custom RP server, for that matter) when it comes to building characters for them. Even with a general guideline provided, the best way to make build decisions is by actually playing on a server. It makes a HUGE difference!

posts.author: Templar
posts.content:
http://wiki.arelith.com/Class

You have to always take 3 consequent levels in a new class. When you take first level in a new class, then you will have to take 2 more levels in the same class afterwards. Therefore it is not possible to have:
Wizard 29 / Rogue 1 (3-levels-in-class rule must be fulfilled even on level 30)
Cleric 2 / Rogue 1 (you need to have 3 levels in each class before taking a new class or continuing to progress in different class)

This means one you have taken the required 3 in a row, you can go in any order because you did the FIRST three in order

Also:
spell changes = http://wiki.arelith.com/Spell_changes
skill and feat changes = http://wiki.arelith.com/Skill_and_feat_changes

posts.author: johnbonmovi
posts.content: With no rogue and such low strength your damage is going to be extremely low unless there is something I'm missing? Most arelith mobs especially epic ones are made of HP, not to mention dealing with enemies with natural damage reduction greater than +5.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
johnbonmovi wrote:With no rogue and such low strength your damage is going to be extremely low unless there is something I'm missing? Most arelith mobs especially epic ones are made of HP, not to mention dealing with enemies with natural damage reduction greater than +5.
TBH, my Cleric/Monks have never suffered of lack of damage, and ALL OF THEM have 8 STR. They're the most competent self-buffers that exist. Now I hear that Arelith has this rule where two spells on the same weapon don't stack, so I would carry around 2 weapons for each hand (1 to buff with Darkfire and another with GMW). The rest of the buffs, like DIvine Power, which sets ur str to 18, and Divine Favor, should work as intended. No Cleric / Monk with at least 8 attacks per round or at most 10 attacks per round is EVER going to do little damage, unless you have epic mobs with 30/- DR, plus 10/- Fire and 10/- Magic damage resistance. There are just too many sources of damage.
